Create LLM Settings database schema and migration
description:
Create an Ecto migration and schema for storing LLM provider configurations:
- Provider name (ollama, openai, anthropic, mistral)
- API keys/tokens (encrypted in database)
- Base URLs
- Default models
- Model preferences for different tasks (vision, text, etc)
- Enable/disable status for each provider
- User-specific settings (one config per user)

Should support secure storage of sensitive credentials.

Build cover letter templates management UI (list, create, edit, delete, set default)
Build LLM Configuration Dashboard Panel
description:
Create a dedicated AI Configuration panel accessible from the main dashboard:

Features:
- Display currently configured LLM providers
- Show status of each provider (configured/not configured)
- Allow enabling/disabling providers
- Show which model is selected for each task type
- Display test connection status for each provider
- Provider-specific settings:
  * Ollama: base URL, default model, vision model
  * OpenAI: API key, model selection
  * Anthropic: API key, model selection
  * Mistral: API key, model selection

Design:
- Tabbed interface for each provider
- Clear visual indicators (green = configured, red = not configured)
- Edit forms with secure input fields for API keys
- Save/Cancel buttons with validation
- Success/error notifications

Persistence: Save all settings to database via new LLM settings schema

title: Research and select Elixir LLM abstraction library
notes: Completed research and selected req_llm as the primary LLM abstraction library for Elixir. Created comprehensive research document with implementation recommendations.

title: Investigate and fix job scraping failure with real URLs
Add LLM configuration validation and service layer
description:
Create backend service for managing LLM configurations:

Services.LLMConfig module:
- get_provider_config(user, provider_name) - retrieve provider settings
- save_provider_config(user, provider_name, config_params) - save settings
- test_connection(provider_name, config) - test if provider is reachable/working
- get_enabled_providers(user) - list all configured providers
- get_provider_status(user) - detailed status of all providers
- validate_api_key(provider, key) - validate API key format/validity

Features:
- Encrypt API keys/tokens before storage
- Decrypt on retrieval
- Validate configuration completeness
- Error handling for connection failures
- Logging of configuration changes
- Support for loading config from env vars as defaults

- Clear credentials

- Show pending/success/error states

Update LLM Service to use database configuration
description:
Refactor Clientats.LLM.Service to load provider configuration from database instead of env vars:

Changes:
- Load provider config from user's settings in database
- Respect enabled/disabled status
- Use configured API keys and URLs from database
- Fallback to environment variables if database config not found
- Cache configuration in memory with TTL to reduce DB queries
- Clear cache when user updates settings

Functions to update:
- extract_job_data_from_url/3
- determine_provider/1
- call_ollama/2
- get_available_providers/0

Error handling:
- Clear error if provider not configured in database
- Suggest user configure the provider via dashboard
